question: Match the following:
columnB: Used extensively in biochemical and genetic work
matches: Ascomycetes – Commonly known as sac-fungi
Penicillium – Mostly multicellular
Yeast (Saccharomyces) – Rarely unicellular
Neurospora – Used extensively in biochemical and genetic work
answer: Ascomycetes – Commonly known as sac-fungi, Penicillium – Mostly multicellular, Yeast (Saccharomyces) – Rarely unicellular, Neurospora – Used extensively in biochemical and genetic work

question: Match the following:
columnB: Saprophytic, decomposers, parasitic or coprophilous (growing on dung)
Ascospores produced endogenously in sac like asci
matches: Habit of ascomycetes – Saprophytic, decomposers, parasitic or coprophilous (growing on dung)
Mycelium of ascomycetes – Branched and septate
Asexual spores of ascomycetes – Conidia produced exogenously on conidiophores
Sexual spores of ascomycetes – Ascospores produced endogenously in sac like asci
answer: Habit of ascomycetes – Saprophytic, decomposers, parasitic or coprophilous (growing on dung), Mycelium of ascomycetes – Branched and septate, Asexual spores of ascomycetes – Conidia produced exogenously on conidiophores, Sexual spores of ascomycetes – Ascospores produced endogenously in sac like asci

question: Match the following:
matches: Asci – Sac like structures containing ascospores
Ascocarps – Different types of fruiting bodies
Morels and truffles – Edible and considered delicacies
Aspergillus, Claviceps and Neurospora – Examples of ascomycetes
answer: Asci – Sac like structures containing ascospores, Ascocarps – Different types of fruiting bodies, Morels and truffles – Edible and considered delicacies, Aspergillus, Claviceps and Neurospora – Examples of ascomycetes

question: Match the following:
matches: Basidiomycetes – Commonly known forms of basidiomycetes
Commonly known forms – Mushrooms, bracket fungi or puffballs
Mycelium of basidiomycetes – Branched and septate
Vegetative reproduction – By fragmentation
answer: Basidiomycetes – Commonly known forms of basidiomycetes, Commonly known forms – Mushrooms, bracket fungi or puffballs, Mycelium of basidiomycetes – Branched and septate, Vegetative reproduction – By fragmentation

question: Match the following:
columnB: Fusion of two vegetative or somatic cells of different strains or genotypes
Fruiting bodies where basidia are arranged
matches: Plasmogamy in basidiomycetes – Fusion of two vegetative or somatic cells of different strains or genotypes
Basidium – Structure arising from dikaryotic condition
Basidiospores – Exogenously produced on the basidium
Basidiocarps – Fruiting bodies where basidia are arranged
answer: Plasmogamy in basidiomycetes – Fusion of two vegetative or somatic cells of different strains or genotypes, Basidium – Structure arising from dikaryotic condition, Basidiospores – Exogenously produced on the basidium, Basidiocarps – Fruiting bodies where basidia are arranged

question: Match the following:
matches: Karyogamy and meiosis in basidiomycetes – Producing four basidiospores in basidium
Common members of basidiomycetes – Agaricus, Ustilago and Puccinia
Deuteromycetes – Commonly known as imperfect fungi
Conidia – Asexual spores of deuteromycetes
answer: Karyogamy and meiosis in basidiomycetes – Producing four basidiospores in basidium, Common members of basidiomycetes – Agaricus, Ustilago and Puccinia, Deuteromycetes – Commonly known as imperfect fungi, Conidia – Asexual spores of deuteromycetes

question: Match the following:
columnB: Moved to ascomycetes and basidiomycetes when discovered
Saprophytes or parasites or decomposers of litter helping in mineral cycling
matches: Sexual forms of deuteromycetes – Moved to ascomycetes and basidiomycetes when discovered
Mycelium of deuteromycetes – Septate and branched
Habit of deuteromycetes – Saprophytes or parasites or decomposers of litter helping in mineral cycling
Examples of deuteromycetes – Alternaria, Colletotrichum and Trichoderma
answer: Sexual forms of deuteromycetes – Moved to ascomycetes and basidiomycetes when discovered, Mycelium of deuteromycetes – Septate and branched, Habit of deuteromycetes – Saprophytes or parasites or decomposers of litter helping in mineral cycling, Examples of deuteromycetes – Alternaria, Colletotrichum and Trichoderma
